oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Aerial view of the area around Bellicourt on the Hindenburg
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This photograph is an aerial view of the Hindenburg Line, with several key land features identified in white ink. The photograph would have been used for British intelligence. It was owned by James M. Johnston during World War I. Pvt. James McFerren Johnston served in the HQ Co., Ord. Corps, attached to the 114th MG Battn., 30th Div. The 30th Div. consisted of National Guard units from Tennessee and North and South Carolina. They served under British command while in Europe.
